noun.description: The path followed by a projectile flying or an object moving under the action of given forces.
examples: the rapid upward trajectory of Rich's career

noun.description: A curve or surface cutting a family of curves or surfaces at a constant angle.

origin: Late 17th century: from modern Latin trajectoria (feminine), from Latin traject- thrown across, from the verb traicere, from trans- across + jacere to throw.
